review: I have the regular FireTV for my main televisions and purchased the FireTV stick on the $19 early buy deal.I am very disappointed that there are programs that run on the FireTV that do not run, or simply are not available, on the FireTV Stick.  This was not mentioned anywhere in the advertising for the FireTV stick.  I assume it has to do with storage limits, it would have been nice to know this up front as all the advertising makes it look like these are identical as far as operation goes.If you want basic streaming and simple games on the cheap this may be an option for you, but I don't recommend it if you are expecting full FireTV functionality.
author: T. Dennis

review: Very well built device. Used in my bedroom to replace a WII for streaming video. Does well and is very responsive.
author: Mishakal

review: Easy to set up. Picture is stunning. Fast and no delay when you turn on your TV. Was able to pair with Fire Phone and use it as remote control but took some time to make it work. Miracast works which is great. Nice set of apps but there are some missing that are must have: HBOgo, network television (ABC, CBS, NBC, Fox), Xfinity online. I use those half of the time I turn my TV on and that comes from my laptop.For any apps that is missing, I just stream it using Miracast from my Fire Phone. Prime Music and cloud music was what sold this stick to me and it did not disappoint. I can't believe they'd sell this only for $39. Now if only I can watch new release movies in HD for $2 I would be happy so I don't have to drive out there to get it from Redbox. If they add those channels I listed, this would be a slam dunk 5 star. There is a bug where it would disconnect from Fire Phone for no reason. Also, the remote app does not even connect no matter what you do most of the time so this is still very buggy.
